meta.name: ü§ñüìù Auto-Document Workflows with GPT-4o-mini Sticky Notes

values.content:
=You are a technical writer specialized in n8n. You write clear, concise, and actionable sticky notes, including bullet points, gotchas, and configuration parameters.

Take in account the following context of the user about the workflow:  {{ $('Your Workflow Description').item.json.Context }}

Please include in the end of the note always my contact informatio, you will se below in the example: 



Here some examples, depending on the node you can add extra information that you think is relevant: 

## üéß Newsletter-to-Audio Conversation Flow

This workflow turns unread newsletters from your email inbox into dynamic audio conversations between two AI voices ‚Äî inspired by **Google's NotebookLM** ability to summarize and humanize dense content.

### ‚ú® How it works:
1. üì® **Fetch Unread Newsletters** using Gmail (e.g., sender: "your_favorite@newsletter.com").
2. üß† **Summarize and Reformat** the content into a dialogue using an LLM (like OpenAI or Gemini).
3. üó£Ô∏è **Generate Voices** for each part of the conversation using a TTS service (e.g., ElevenLabs, Google TTS).
4. üéõÔ∏è **Merge Audio Segments** into a natural back-and-forth flow using FFmpeg or audio nodes.
5. üì§ **Send the Final Audio** file back to your email inbox (or deliver to another channel like Telegram or Drive).

### üí° Inspired by:
NotebookLM's approach to making long-form text more digestible by turning it into personalized, conversational summaries.

You can modify:
- üéôÔ∏è The tone and voice of the personas
- üïµÔ∏è Email filters (e.g., subject or sender)
- üì´ The delivery method (email, storage, etc.)

> Ideal for turning passive subscriptions into engaging, hands-free content.


### 

üì¨ Need help or want to collaborate?

If you have any questions, need help setting this up, or want to share feedback ‚Äî feel free to reach out:  
üì© **Luis.acosta@news2podcast.com** or DM me in twitter [@guanchehacker](http:\www.x.com/GuancheHacker) 

If you're looking to build something more advanced with audio and AI, let me know and I‚Äôll figure out how I can help you!

=Generate a general sticky note to document this n8n workflow. Include:
H2 with the workflow title
Goal (3‚Äì4 sentences)
How it works (bullets)
Parameters to configure
Limitations / Gotchas
Expected result
Maximum 220‚Äì250 words, in Markdown.
Workflow summary (trimmed JSON):
{{ $json.nodesSummaryText }}

parameters.jsCode:
const arr = $json.realNodes || [];
return arr.map(n => ({ json: n }));

values.content:
=You are a technical writer specialized in n8n. You write clear, concise, and actionable sticky notes, including bullet points, gotchas, and configuration parameters if necessary.

Important: For simple nodes, with out or with a few parameters (e.g., Click Trigger, Merge, Write File, Read File) just write the title and short sticky notee.

If necessary, take in account the following context of the user about the workflow:  {{ $('Your Workflow Description').item.json.Context }}

For complex nodes (e.g., Code, AI Agent, ‚Ä¶), please follow the structure below. Consider the node‚Äôs content (such as the prompt or code) to explain its purpose in a customized way.

## üìÅ Load Workflow 

### üéØ Purpose
Load an existing workflow from a specified file path to facilitate automation and documentation efforts.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - File path to the workflow JSON.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Loaded workflow data for further use in the automation process.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **File Selector:** 
  - Specify the path to the workflow JSON file, e.g., `/Your_path_to_file/workflow.json`.
  
### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the file path is correct and accessible by n8n to avoid file not found errors.
- Validate the JSON structure of the workflow file to prevent loading issues; malformed JSON will lead to errors during processing.

parameters.content:
## üìù Workflow Documentation Helper  

### Goal:  
This workflow automates the documentation process for your n8n workflows, generating structured sticky notes quickly. By using various nodes, it transforms workflow components into a comprehensive draft that can be easily edited. This helps streamline the documentation, saving you time and effort while ensuring consistency.  

### How it works:  
- ü¶∏ **Trigger Manually** using the manual execution node.  
- üß© **Parse Your Workflow** to extract necessary details.  
- üõ†Ô∏è **Compile Sticky Notes** for each node using the OpenAI node.  
- ‚öôÔ∏è **Merge and Format** information into a cohesive layout with custom code.  
- üìÅ **Read and Write Files** to save and load the workflow documentation.  
- üîÑ **Convert to JSON** for easy storage and future editing.  

### Parameters to configure:  
- üìÑ Input file path for workflows to be documented.  
- üî† Custom formatting styles for generated sticky notes.  
- üí¨ Node-specific settings within the OpenAI integration.  

### Limitations / Gotchas:  
- Ensure all node types are supported by the OpenAI and parsing logic.  
- Manual intervention may be needed for highly complex workflows.  
- Be cautious with file permissions for reading/writing documentation.

### Expected result:  
The workflow will produce a neatly structured sticky note draft that includes an overview and specifics of each node, enhancing the documentation process and making it readily available for review.  


### üì¨ Need help or want to collaborate?  
If you have any questions, need help setting this up, or want to share feedback ‚Äî feel free to reach out:  
üì© **Luis.acosta@news2podcast.com** or DM me in Twitter [@guanchehacker](http://www.x.com/GuancheHacker)  

If you're looking to build something more advanced with documentation automation, let me know and I‚Äôll figure out how I can help you!

## üìù Save Documented Workflow 

### üéØ Purpose
Save the current workflow as a JSON file to aid in documentation and provide a reusable format for future reference.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - None.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A saved JSON file containing the documented workflow.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **File Name:** 
  - Specify the file path and name, e.g., `/Your_path_to_file/workflow-with-sticky.json`.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the specified file path is writable by n8n to prevent permission denied errors.
- Remember to update the file name if you're saving different versions to avoid overwriting previous documentation.

## üõ† Assemble Workflow

### üéØ Purpose
Facilitates the organization and creation of a workflow by assembling nodes, setting positions, and including sticky notes for documentation.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Array of node data including wrapping workflow, stickies, moves, and overview content.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Assembled workflow JSON with organized nodes and corresponding sticky notes.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Nodes:** 
  - Define nodes as part of the workflow.
- **Stickies:** 
  - Specify additional sticky notes to include in the final JSON.
- **Moves:** 
  - Provide mapping for node positions to rearrange nodes accordingly.
- **Overview Content:** 
  - Custom overview text to be displayed in the designated sticky note.

### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- Ensure the `wrappedWorkflow` is correctly specified; failure to provide it will throw an error.
- The `stickyNote` nodes are removed before adding new stickies, so previous sticky notes won't remain in the final output.
- When arranging nodes, valid positional data should be included in the `moves` to ensure nodes are correctly placed.
- The overview sticky note is always positioned to the left, based on the calculated positions of other nodes‚Äîconsider adjusting node placements accordingly.

## üåÄ Merge2 

### üéØ Purpose
Combine multiple input streams into a single output stream based on their respective positions.

## üìÅ Layout Blocks RTL 

### üéØ Purpose
Generate sticky notes to document nodes in a workflow, positioning them right to left for improved readability and organization.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - A collection of nodes to be documented.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Sticky notes with descriptions and positioning adjustments based on the nodes they correspond to.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Node Width (NODE_W):** 
  - Set the visual width of an n8n node (default: 300).
- **Node Height (NODE_H):** 
  - Set the visual height of an n8n node (default: 100).
- **Sticky Note Width (STICKY_W):** 
  - Set the width of the sticky notes (default: 380).
- **Sticky Note Height (STICKY_H):** 
  - Set the height of the sticky notes (default: 1020).
- **Color (STICKY_COLOR):** 
  - Choose the color of the sticky notes (default: 7 for white).
- **Gaps (GAP_X, GAP_Y, ROW_GAP):** 
  - Configure the horizontal and vertical gaps between blocks and rows.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the nodes provided as input include the required properties, such as `type` and `position`.
- Adjust **MAX_PER_ROW** to manage how many sticky notes appear in a single row; set to high values (e.g., 9999) to avoid wrapping.
- Verify alignment tweaks (`CENTER_TWEAK_X`, `CENTER_TWEAK_Y`) if sticky notes do not align as expected.

## üîÑ Rename Overview 

### üéØ Purpose
This node extracts the `content` from a JSON message and renames the output to `overviewContent`, aiding in the organization of workflow documentation.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:**
  - A JSON object containing a `message` with the field `content`.
- **Outputs:**
  - A new JSON object where the extracted content is stored under the key `overviewContent`.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **jsCode:** 
  - JavaScript code that performs the extraction and renaming. The provided code is:
    ```javascript
    return [{ json: { overviewContent: $json.message.content } }];
    ```

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the input JSON contains a valid `message` object with a `content` field to prevent errors during processing.
- Use this node to streamline workflow documentation by giving a clear and concise overview extracted from your data.

## üîó Merge

### üéØ Purpose
Combine multiple input data sets into a single output by aligning them according to their positions.

## üìÅ Get Content 

### üéØ Purpose
Extracts the `content` field from incoming messages, returning a structured array for further processing in the workflow.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:**
  - An array of objects, each potentially containing a `message` with a `content` field.
- **Outputs:**
  - An array of objects with each object containing a `content` field.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **JavaScript Code (`jsCode`):**
  - The custom JavaScript code that processes incoming data to extract the `content`. 
  - Code snippet:
    ```javascript
    return $input.all().map(it => ({
      json: { content: it.json?.message?.content ?? '' }
    }));
    ```

### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- The code uses optional chaining (`?.`) and a fallback (`?? ''`), meaning if a `content` field is missing, it will return an empty string instead of `undefined`.
- Ensure that the incoming messages have the expected structure to avoid unexpected output.
- Use this node at the point in your workflow where you need to aggregate or process message contents effectively.

## üìù Node Sticky Notes 

### üéØ Purpose
This node assists in generating draft sticky notes for documenting workflows automatically, allowing users to streamline their documentation process without starting from scratch.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:**
  - Workflow title and JSON content for note drafting.
- **Outputs:**
  - Draft sticky note that summarizes the workflow, including critical information and parameters for user reference.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Model ID:** 
  - Choose the AI model for generating the sticky notes (default: `gpt-4o-mini`).
- **Messages:** 
  - Customize the initiation message for context-aware note generation.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the workflow context is provided to enrich the relevance of the generated notes.
- Double-check the parameters used in your node for accuracy to enhance the final output quality.

## üìÅ Split Out Items 

### üéØ Purpose
Transform a list of nodes into individual items for easier manipulation and processing in your workflow.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - A list of real nodes as an array from the previous step in the workflow.
- **Outputs:** 
  - An array of JSON objects, each representing an individual node.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **JavaScript Code (jsCode):** 
  - This code extracts the nodes from the input array and returns them as individual JSON objects:
    ```javascript
    const arr = $json.realNodes || [];
    return arr.map(n => ({ json: n }));
    ```

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the input contains the `realNodes` key populated with an array. If it‚Äôs null or undefined, the output will be an empty array.
- Test your workflow after implementing this node to confirm that items are split as expected.

## üìù Overall Sticky Note

### üéØ Purpose
The "Overall Sticky Note" node is designed to generate a comprehensive draft for documenting n8n workflows. It simplifies the documentation process by creating an initial sticky note that provides structure and essential information about the workflow‚Äôs functionality.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:**
  - User context to tailor the note based on their specific workflow details.
- **Outputs:**
  - A polished sticky note formatted in Markdown, ready for further editing or direct use.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Workflow Title:** 
  - The title of the workflow to be documented.
- **User Context:** 
  - Information about the workflow provided by the user, which informs the content of the note.

### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- Ensure that the user context is accurately defined for a more personalized and relevant sticky note.
- The resulting content should be reviewed and edited for clarity and completeness, as the auto-generated note serves as a first draft.
- Stick to the suggested word limit (220-250 words) to maintain readability.

### üì¨ Need help or want to collaborate?
If you have any questions, need help setting this up, or want to share feedback ‚Äî feel free to reach out:  
üì© **Luis.acosta@news2podcast.com** or DM me on Twitter [@guanchehacker](http://www.x.com/GuancheHacker).  
If you're looking to build something more advanced with audio and AI, let me know, and I‚Äôll figure out how I can help you!

## üìÅ Parse Workflow 

### üéØ Purpose
Parse and unwrap a given workflow JSON to create a structured output that excludes sticky notes and presents an overview of the real nodes.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Workflow JSON that may have multiple formats, including nested structures.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A structured workflow object with a summary of nodes for documentation purposes.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **JavaScript Code (jsCode):** 
  - The embedded script to unwrap and refine the workflow input, identifying nodes suitable for documentation.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the workflow JSON is provided in one of the expected formats to prevent errors:
  - `{ workflow: { data: {...} }, nodes: [] }`
  - `{ data: { nodes } }`
  - `{ nodes }`
- The node filters out sticky note types; consider any implications for your documentation strategy.
- Monitor the output; a maximum of 50 nodes will be included in the summary for brevity.

## üìÅ Convert to JSON 

### üéØ Purpose
Convert data from a specified source into JSON format to facilitate integration and data manipulation within workflows.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Source data that needs to be converted into JSON.
- **Outputs:** 
  - JSON-formatted data ready for further processing or use in automation tasks.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Operation:** 
  - Set to `fromJson` to indicate the conversion operation being performed.
- **Encoding:** 
  - Specify the character encoding to be used (default is `utf8`), ensuring proper handling of text data.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Double-check that the source data is valid and correctly formatted to avoid conversion issues.
- Ensure that JSON output meets the expected structure for downstream nodes in the workflow.

## üìÅ Load Workflow 

### üéØ Purpose
Load an existing workflow from a specified file path to facilitate automation and documentation efforts.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - File path to the workflow JSON.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Loaded workflow data for further use in the automation process.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **File Selector:** 
  - Specify the path to the workflow JSON file, e.g., `/Your_path_to_file/workflow.json`.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the file path is correct and accessible by n8n to avoid file not found errors.
- Validate the JSON structure of the workflow file to prevent loading issues; malformed JSON will lead to errors during processing.

## üìù Your Workflow Description 

### üéØ Purpose
Facilitates the documentation of workflows by generating an initial draft for your sticky note, saving time and effort in the documentation process.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - None specified.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A first draft of the sticky note documenting the workflow.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Assignments:**
  - **Name:** "Context"
  - **Value:** Provides a brief description of the workflow's purpose: "This workflow is a helper for documenting workflows."

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Utilize the generated sticky note as a foundation for more detailed documentation, customizing it as needed.
- Review and refine the draft to ensure it meets your documentation standards before finalizing.

## üñ±Ô∏è When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô

### üéØ Purpose
Trigger the execution of the current workflow manually through the n8n interface.

## üåÄ Merge1 

### üéØ Purpose
Combine data streams from multiple sources into a single output, facilitating data integration and streamlined processing.

assignments.name: Context
assignments.value: This workflow is a helper for documenting workflows. It creates a first draft of your sticky note so you don‚Äôt have to start from scratch with the documentation.
